node.title: Hundreds of international students to arrive in Sydney on charter flight despite Omicron ban
node.alt: A passenger walks next to a departures sign at Sydney International Airport
node.description: A charter flight with up to 250 international students is set to fly into Sydney next week even after a Federal Government delayed the easing of border restrictions due to the Omicron variant.
node.content:
["Hundreds of international students will arrive in Sydney next week, despite the federal government delaying the easing of border restrictions because of the Omicron COVID-19 variant.", "A charter flight carrying\u00a0up to 250 students will land in Sydney on December 6.", "The federal government had been due to ease border restrictions\u00a0for international students and other eligible visa holders tomorrow, but that has been deferred until December 15 due to concerns about the Omicron COVID-19 strain.", "Despite that, the NSW government will proceed with its international student pilot program which it announced in September.", "That means hundreds of students will be able to arrive in Sydney despite the tougher federal government stance.", "The students will be subject to strict new quarantine measures introduced over the past few days.", "Non-Australian citizens from eight southern African countries have been banned from travelling Down Under.", "Australians who have been in\u00a0the affected nations \u2014 South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, Eswatini and Malawi \u2014 must quarantine for 14 days on their arrival in Australia in a health facility.", "Meanwhile, all international arrivals must spend 72 hours in isolation at their home or accommodation after touching down in Australia.", "\"International Students who enter NSW will need to isolate for 72 hours as per the current NSW Public Health Orders,\" the Deputy Liberal leader Stuart Ayres said.", "The students will isolate at a student accommodation facility in Redfern for the 3 days.", "The ABC understands none of the students are from southern African countries.", "They are from more than 15 countries including Singapore, China and Canada.", "\"NSW will continue to monitor the situation relating to the Omicron variant and make any changes necessary,\" Mr Ayres said.\u00a0", "", "
Stuart Ayres said the NSW Government would closely\u00a0monitor the Omicron situation.(AAP: Bianca De Marchi)
", "The state government decided to pursue the scheme even after the federal government announced changes to the border restrictions for international students last week.", "The federal\u00a0government said\u00a0the temporary pause on international students will allow it to gather further information about new Omicron variant of COVID-19.\u00a0", "The Commonwealth has approved NSW pursuing its international student plan, separate to the border delay.", "A second charted flight of another 250 International students is scheduled to arrive in Sydney on December 24.", "More flights are due every two weeks.", "All students who arrive must be fully vaccinated, with an Australian approved vaccine.\u00a0"]
